pain3.title: Manual processing

demo.note: Your browser will ask for microphone permission. This is required to capture your voice.

q1.question: Does the respondent need to install anything?
q1.answer: No. Voice Capture works directly in the browser. The only requirement is that the respondent grants microphone permission when the browser asks — it's a standard permission, just like Google Meet or Zoom.

q2.question: Am I charged for abandoned or failed responses?
q2.answer: No. Only successfully completed responses count. If the respondent abandons before submitting, or if the transcription fails due to a technical error, it does not count against your monthly quota.

q3.question: What if the respondent doesn't want to speak?
q3.answer: The widget includes a text mode as an alternative. The respondent can type their response if they prefer not to use the microphone. Both modes count as one response.

q4.question: Does it work on mobile?
q4.answer: Yes. Voice Capture works on Chrome, Safari, Firefox, and Edge — both desktop and mobile. The experience is optimized for touch screens.

q5.question: Can I integrate it with my survey platform?
q5.answer: Yes. Voice Capture integrates with Alchemer, Qualtrics, and any web form that accepts custom HTML. Just paste a code snippet — no development required.

q6.question: Where is the data stored?
q6.answer: Audio and transcriptions are stored on secure infrastructure with encryption at rest and in transit. You can configure domain locking so the widget only works on your authorized sites.
